Straight Shot continues to give Kup the data he needs, to continue trying t=
o divert the remaining sweeps from the fortress, although it seemed to work=
 for a while, it now appeared that the enemy may have caught wise to their =
strategy.

"Kup, hate ta break this to ya but, I think those jet heads are =
onta us...  Aww maaan, that transmission we got from Tucson, they must've h=
eard it."

From above, Rat Trap holds onto Windlord tightly, now realizing =
what was going on himself.  He too had gotten Tucsons transmission.

"Oh no=
o, I think that transmission we got from Wheels got to those Decepticreeps =
somehow..  They've changed trajectory, but now they're gon' after Wheels hi=
mself!"

From the ground, Tucson realizes the dangers, quickly trying to ga=
ther intel with his sonar systems, and firing according to the data recieve=
d from them.  For this, he relies on his missile launchers from his trailer=
, firing a few rounds at a time.

"Rodimus, it's time.  Tell Quickstride to=
 get into battle mode and prepare for combat immediately.  I need you to do=
 the same, and get the shields up and running at the Ark.  They're onto us,=
 and there's no time to reformat the plan.  It's all or nothing now."

He t=
hen pays attention to his enemy.

"Fire at me all you want, I'm not afraid =
of any of you."

He puts on an extremely brave and determined face as he pl=
ants himself firmly on his wheels, stabilizing himself so that the kickback=
 from his missile carriers does not tip him over onto his side.  Shots ring=
 out like echoing booms as hydraulics hum with each recoil of the weapon.

=
Night Shift now tries to communicate with his leader.

" Hey, if I were you=
, I'd dish out the sonar waves, if ya know what I mean."

Tucson gets Night=
 Shift's transmission.

" I wonder..  You may be onto something...  All rig=
ht, attempting Sonar scrambling now.  Everyone, brace yourselves, this coul=
d effect not just our enemy but us as well.  I'll do my best to configure t=
he wave so that it doesn't harm us, but it may just cause some inconvenienc=
e."

He begins to send out a strong sonar wave, in hopes that it would foul=
 up the remaining sweep's trajectory.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super=
 Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

mus, you're right, somethn' just caught those jet's attentions..

 firing range, Night Shift could see that Tucson's ploy was

traight Shot works in unisen with Kup. With the arrows fired,

ot gives Kup the data he needs to make a direct hit, via using

al weaponry form, and her guidence systems. It was now up to Kup

e rest.

he trajectory

ins to focus on

ift nodds.

 still though,
> they could get a fix on us and then we're curtains. I vote=
 we slowly change
> our locations after a few shots, so that way we can con=
fuse the living heck
> outa their processors."
> >
> > From Tucson's vantag=
e point, although unable to see what was happening, he
> keeps his com link=
s open to his colleagues. And from what he could surmise,
> things were goi=
ng according to plan. But yet he still had to think of the
> "What If's." T=
here was always a chance that even a well thought out strategy
> could go a=
wry.

> > "From what I hear,things appear to be going well. But we can n=
ot discount

ntinue on your
> paths, but be cautious."

 Windlord was happy to see that the jets were
> being distracted away from =
the fortress.

> > "We copy that Wheels, okay Windlord, I think we can m=
ake our move, the
> distraction's working. I'll leave it up ta you ta find =
the best way in. You
> know this place better than I do."
> >
> > Tucson no=
w continues to move in slowly. He keeps to hidden areas on the
> land with =
low vegitation, and travels by river beds, to be sure that his
> tires do n=
ot kick up any dirt or rubble. His trailer keeps him from moving
> too fast=
, as he tries to maneuver it through the terrain. That however did
> not bo=
ther him in the least. He had never been one for speed, even in his
> old S=
UV form. Things seemed rather familliar to him now, the way the
> situation=
 was playing out, reminded him of older times, when Optimus Prime
> would l=
ead his Autobots against the Decepticons and how careful he was with
> his =
strategic skills. And now, it was Tucson Prime's turn to roll in Optimus
> =
Prime's tire treads. As Hydras was a cobination of Galvatron and Megatron,
=
> Tucson Prime now comes to terms that Optimus Prime was now living within
=
> himself and for all intensive purposes, he is now the new Optimus Prime. =
He
> now sends a message to all Autobots and Maximals.
> >
> > " Before I m=
et up with all of you, my direction was unclear. I thought
> that I'd be fi=
ghting a losing battle by myself, and for a long time, it
> seemed that way=
. But then, along my travels, I met all of you, and you
> brought me home, =
to the Ark, where you showed me where Optimus Prime rests.
> At first, I wi=
shed intensely that Optimus Prime could be brought back to
> life, and I be=
lieved that for the longest time. Then, as I got to know all
> of you, and =
realized the big picture of what was happening, and then,
> recieving the p=
ower of the Matrix of Leadership, I have now come to realize
> that it's fa=
r better to look ahead at who is around you now, and what is to
> happen in=
 the future than to dwell on that of the past. All of that would
> not have=
 been possible if I had not met all of you. And for that I thank
> each and=
 every Autobot and Maximal for putting me on the right path. And
> now, it'=
s time for me to repay my debt to you all."
> >
> > He thinks for a moment.=

> >
> > " As Optimus Prime stood firmly against Megatron and the Deceptico=
n
> Faction, I will firmly stand my ground against the Predacons and
> Dece=
pticons. And by the end of this battle, we will show them that it's
> unwis=
e to underestimate our factions as they have done so up until now."
> >
> >=
 He inches closser into his position.

> <NEW>
> 
> The sweeps continue t=
o close, their boosters flaring as they streak in,
> momentarily showing up=
 on thermal radar and then disappearing as they
> shifted back to antigrav =
engines.
> 
> The four remaining sweeps are now far more wary of attacks fr=
om Kup and
> Straight shot and use their aerial agility and superior speed =
to the best
> advantage. The circle around laying down heavier and heavier =
fire as the
> group.
> 
> As Tuscon soliloquizes about his own state of aff=
airs and how they affect
> his new status and thoughts, it is almost as if =
the sweeps can hear him, or
> more then likely they can hear him talking in=
to the radio. The Sweeps are
> said to be able to locate a single ameba in =
the vast oceans of a planet,
> locating a single voice in the cacophony of =
battle would present no problem.
> Two of them peel off and begin to fire a=
t Tuscon!
> 
> *          *          *          *          *
> 
> Meanwhile=
 as Windlord and Rat Trap approached and flew around they can see
> the des=
olation around the tower. There is absolutely no vegetation around
> the to=
wer or within several miles of it. There is only broken ground and a
> larg=
e lake several miles across, filled with bubbling and broiling liquid
> roc=
k! Flight sensors show that the thermal updrafts from the lake would make
>=
 the trip for Windlord difficult but not impossible.
> 
> The tower itself =
extends directly out of the magma itself and only the fact
> that it is cra=
fted from some sort of Cybertronian enhanced metal that keeps
> it from dro=
pping into the same liquid state as the magma around it.
> 
> Thermal senso=
rs show that at its bottom, where the tower meets the magma, it
> is nearly=
 the same temperature as the liquid stone, but evidently the tower
> has be=
en sitting raised for quite some time because the top of it is much
> coole=
r. While still extremely hot, it is possible that for a very limited
> time=
 someone may be able to crawl around the upper most section of the
> tower.=
 However to deposit someone there would mean they would have to fly
> over =
the large magma lake, and there is no cover of any sort, they would
> almos=
t definitely be seen.
> 
> So far there has been no response from the tower=
 itself.
> 
> OOC: The tower looks something like the telescoping tower tha=
t rose up out
> of the ocean that the Decepticons used in the 80's cartoon.=
